data.title: Philadelphia Basketball Referee
data.meta_description: 2021 Olympics  Basketball 2021 officials, referees,  teams, games, schedule, groups, seeds
data.text: 08/12/21 news Paris A big salute to French Olympic heroes from the French press Paris (France) - France's basketball players, both men and women, are being feted as heroes in the City of Light following their return from the Tokyo Olympics. 08/11/21 news Sydney Media hails dominant Team USA in Tokyo TOKYO (Japan) - The United States underlined their status as the world's best men's basketball team during the Games of the XXXII Olympiad. Here's how the media has reacted to the USA's latest triumph. 08/10/21 news Tokyo 'Skeletons jumping around, drinking beers, dancing and crying' - Aussie greats celebrate long-awaited bronze SYDNEY (Australia) - Some called Australia's Bronze Medal Game triumph over Slovenia a game for the ages. It certainly was for everyone Down Under. 08/09/21 news Tokyo Five unforgettable Olympic basketball moments TOKYO (Japan) - The dust has just begun to settle on the men's Olympic Tournament that had plenty of twists and turns. What are the plays or events that we remember for eternity? Here are our picks. 08/08/21 news Tokyo Five nations represented in the All-Star Five of the Men's Olympic Basketball Tournament TOKYO (Japan) - Sorted by positions - two guards, two forwards and one center - the All-Star Five members hail from five different teams from the Men's Olympic Basketball Tournament. 08/08/21 news Tokyo Kevin Durant takes MVP honors from the Men's Olympic Basketball Tournament in Tokyo TOKYO (Japan) - The United States bounced back from their opening day defeat to France to take their fourth consecutive gold. Kevin Durant set the USA's tone and identity and is our Olympic tourney MVP. 08/07/21 news Tokyo Tournament tracker: Memorable tournament finished in Tokyo TOKYO (Japan) - Our Tournament Tracker keeps you up to date with an overview of what has been happening at the Men's Olympic Basketball Tournament in the Japanese capital. 08/07/21 news Tokyo Player of the Bronze Medal Game Australia's | Pat Mills TOKYO (Japan) - Pat Mills poured in 42 points and handed out nine assists to lead Australia to victory over Slovenia with a spot on the podium at stake. Mills is the Player of the Bronze Medal Game. 08/07/21 press Tokyo Team USA win fourth straight gold as France take silver and Australia bronze at the Tokyo 2020 Men’s Olympic Basketball Tournament TOKYO (Japan) – Team USA edge past France to win their fourth-consecutive Olympic title with Australia completing the podium at the Tokyo 2020 Men’s Olympic Basketball Tournament. 08/07/21 game Tokyo Mills takes over, sends Australia men to first Olympic podium finish TOKYO (Japan) - After four fourth-place finishes in the past, Australia finally leave an Olympic tournament with a win. This time, it means they claim their first medal in men's basketball. 08/07/21 news Tokyo Don't forget about the other guys: ''Their only reward was seeing us win gold'' TOKYO (Japan) - While Kevin Durant was enjoying the accolades of the world, while Jayson Tatum was knocking down shots, while the USA were coming up with big stops, three guys could just smile from... 08/07/21 game Tokyo Durant flirts with a record as USA take fourth straight Olympic gold TOKYO (Japan) - In an Olympic Gold Medal Game for the ages, Kevin Durant took matters into his own hands and nearly set a new scoring record in the process as the USA win an 87-82 thriller over... 08/06/21 news Tokyo X-Factors for Gold Medal Throwdown TOKYO (Japan) - The USA have hit stride in their bid for a fourth straight Gold Medal Game, yet the results are proof enough that France will be a considerable hurdle to clear. Here are some X... 08/06/21 preview Tokyo Famous first: Slovenia or Australia are going to win their first medal on Saturday TOKYO (Japan) - They both were so close to the Final, then suffered heartbreaking defeats in Semi-Finals. But they need to bounce back as soon as possible as their first Olympic medal is within reach. 08/06/21 news Tokyo Mission impossible ahead of France: Nobody has defeated USA twice at the same Olympics TOKYO (Japan) - The last time the United States won four straight gold medals in Olympic history was back in the 1950s and 1960s when they had a run of seven in a row. France will try to keep it that... 08/06/21 news Tokyo Japan honors basketball players, patrons with famous Ukiyo-e artwork TOKYO (Japan) - The Japanese have left no stone unturned to make the Olympic basketball tournaments memorable for all involved. That includes displaying a genre of artwork, Ukiyo-e, outside the stadium. 08/06/21 news Tokyo Fan Vote: Who is your MVP of the Men's Olympic Basketball Tournament? TOKYO (Japan) - The FIBA Men's Olympic Basketball Tournament has had a bevy of spectacular performances. Here's your chance to vote for who you think is MVP of the competition before the last two games. 08/05/21 review Tokyo Three takeaways from France v Slovenia: Defense on Doncic, TLC factor, end of a streak TOKYO (Japan) - It was one of the greatest games of the Olympics, with so much offensive and defensive talent, and one block was all that was between them. France's adjustments sent them to the Final. 08/05/21 news Tokyo Player of the Day | France's Nando de Colo TOKYO (Japan) - Nando de Colo put on a riveting display for France, leading Les Bleus to victory over Slovenia with his scoring and all-around playmaking. He is our Player of the Day. 08/05/21 game Tokyo Batum's block sends France to the Final TOKYO (Japan) - It is France! Les Bleus ended Luka Doncic's perfect run in 18 games for Slovenia, 90-89, with Batum's behind-the-back backboard block at the buzzer. 08/05/21 news Tokyo Three takeaways from USA v Australia: It's all about D, KD and lack of AB TOKYO (Japan) - From the 5:23 mark of the second quarter to the end of the third quarter, Team USA went on a 48-14 thanks to the three key factors coming together. Just as their team is coming together. 08/05/21 game Tokyo USA erase 15-point deficit, storm through to the fourth-straight Final TOKYO (Japan) - Australia gave the USA their best run after they owned 41-26 late first-half lead, but then witnessed one of the most dominant performances in recent history as Team USA won 97-78. 08/05/21 news Miami USA men's basketball ready for rematch vs. Australia MIAMI (United States) - The United States remain firm in their goal of conquering their fourth consecutive Olympic gold medal - the seventh in the last eight games - and it seems that they have found... 08/04/21 news Tokyo Ode to Scola and the Gasol brothers TOKYO (Japan) - What can be said about Argentina's Luis Scola, and Spain's Gasol brothers, Pau and Marc, that hasn't already been in their careers? The trio has retired from international basketball. 08/04/21 news Miami 'I'm leaving in peace': Luis Scola retires with impactful legacy MIAMI (USA) - With less than a minute remaining in Argentina’s Olympic quarterfinal men’s basketball game vs. Australia in Tokyo, play was halted for a substitution. It wasn’t just any change from the... 08/03/21 news Tokyo USA erase 15-point deficit, storm through to the fourth-straight Final TOKYO (Japan) - Australia gave the USA their best run after they owned 41-26 late first-half lead, but then witnessed one of the most dominant performances in recent history as Team USA won 97-78. news 08/03/21 news Player of the Day | France's Nicolas Batum TOKYO (Japan) - Nicolas Batum put in a sterling, all-round effort on Tuesday to help France win their Quarter-Final against Italy and advance to a showdown with Slovenia. He's our Player of the Day. 08/03/21 news Tokyo Basketball tournaments blossom in Tokyo with Molten special edition ball TOKYO (Japan) - The latest official game ball presented by FIBAs' long-standing partner Molten, the BG5000 FIBA Special Edition, has been a big hit at the men's and women's Olympic Basketball... 08/03/21 news Miami Argentina find themselves in familiar situation ahead of Olympic Quarter-Finals MIAMI (United States) - Argentina has continued to dominate since the 2004 Olympic Games in Athens when they won the gold medal. In their five consecutive Olympics trips they have always reached the... 08/02/21 preview Tokyo USA and Spain renew Olympic rivalry and other captivating Quarter-Finals TOKYO (Japan) - When the Quarter-Finals of the Olympics are played on Tuesday, one showdown more than any other catches the eye. A heavyweight-esque battle between the USA and Spain awaits. 08/02/21 news Tokyo Men's Olympic Basketball Power Rankings - Volume 3 TOKYO (Japan) - We are a day away from the Quarter-Finals in the Saitama Super Arena. That gives us one last chance to update the Power Rankings before the teams sort out the actual rankings on the... 08/02/21 news Tokyo Who was the most impressive player of the Group Stage in Tokyo? TOKYO (Japan) - The first part of the competition in Japan is over, and on the eve of the Quarter-Finals, we are ready to hear your thoughts. Who impressed you the most during these Olympic Games? 08/02/21 news Tokyo USA and Spain renew Olympic rivalry and other captivating Quarter-Finals TOKYO (Japan) - When the Quarter-Finals of the Olympics are played on Tuesday, one showdown more than any other catches the eye. A heavyweight-esque battle between the USA and Spain awaits. 08/01/21 review Tokyo Day 8: A window into the beautiful madness to come over the final week TOKYO (Japan) - We should lead you into this daily recap with a classic "it doesn't get any better than this," but after seeing the Quarter-Finals pairings, it does. It does get even better than this. 08/01/21 news Tokyo Player of the Day | Slovenia's Mike Tobey TOKYO (Japan) - Mike Tobey had his best and most impactful performance yet for Slovenia as the Olympic newbies took down Spain. With his game-high +26 efficiency, Tobey is our Player of the Day. 08/01/21 press Tokyo Final Phase Draw results: Pairings confirmed for the men’s knockout rounds at Tokyo 2020 TOKYO (Japan) - The pairings for the men's knockout out rounds at Olympic Basketball Tournament are now confirmed following the draw that took place after the final Group Phase game. 07/31/21 review Tokyo Day 7: New leaders keeping the Old Continent on top of the world TOKYO (Japan) - France, Italy, Germany, Slovenia and Spain will make up more than 50 percent of the field in the Quarter-Finals. It's the second time in a row that Europe has five teams in the elite... 07/31/21 news Tokyo Player of the Day | USA's Kevin Durant TOKYO (Japan) - Did Kevin Durant need a couple of games under his belt before playing his best in Tokyo? It eems so. But with his 23 point eruption over the Czechs, a nearly-unstoppable KD may be... 07/31/21 news Tokyo Will Doncic and Slovenia finally meet their match against Spain? We're about to find out! TOKYO (Japan) - So here we are, licking our lips at the prospect of a Luka Doncic-fueled Slovenia taking on Spain - the most dominant team of Europe for the past two decades. 07/30/21 news Tokyo Once Brothers, Argentine edition: ''Whoever wins, we'll still be friends'' TOKYO (Japan) - Sport has its ways of throwing curveballs at you when you least expect it. It usually serves as a means of connecting the best of enemies, but sometimes it tests the closest of... 07/30/21 news Tokyo Permutations: With one game to go, here's how teams can qualify for the Olympic Quarter-Finals TOKYO (Japan) - As the men's players enjoy their day off the court on Friday, assistant coaches and staff members are spending it with calculators in their hands, figuring out how to get to the next... 07/30/21 news Tokyo Player of the Day | Spain's Ricky Rubio TOKYO (Japan) - Ricky Rubio is the Player of the Day | after wreaking havoc with his scoring, passing and defense against Argentina in an 81-71 triumph that clinched Spain's spot in the Quarter-Finals. 07/29/21 news Tokyo Day 5: Defense wins championships, offense wins fans all over the world TOKYO (Japan) - Sergio Scariolo must be worried about fighting Slovenia for the first place in the group. But at the same time, he's probably smiling and coming up with a masterplan in the background. 07/29/21 preview Tokyo World Cup redux: Spain, Argentina square off in Saitama TOKYO (Japan) - Spain and Argentina are revving their engines and getting ready for their Olympic showdown, the latest high-stakes clash between these traditional powerhouses of international... 07/28/21 review Tokyo Day 4: Go big or go home, basketball is a bit easier when you're tall TOKYO (Japan) - We're in 2021, so you probably know by now that basketball is a bit easier when you're tall. Teams like Slovenia, France, Australia, Germany, Czech Republic took it to extreme levels. 07/28/21 news Miami Luis Scola becomes fourth all-time scorer in Men's Olympic Basketball tournament MIAMI (USA) - When you talk about Luis Scola you have to mention he’s one of the greatest players at the national team level. The Argentine has a brilliant record and has now added a new milestone in... 07/27/21 news Tokyo Vote Now: Who's next to pick up a triple-double at the Olympics? TOKYO (Japan) - The records have been the talk of the town in the Saitama Super Arena. With the monster numbers in today's basketball, it wouldn't surprise if somebody picked up a triple-double here. 07/27/21 news Rio De Janeiro Oscar hopes Doncic breaks his own single-game Olympic scoring record of 55 points RIO DE JANEIRO (Brazil) - Basketball legend Oscar Schmidt is such a fan of Luka Doncic that he hopes the Slovenian will break his Olympics single-game scoring record of 55 points. Doncic's debut came... 07/27/21 news Tokyo Okogie strives to build a winning culture within Nigeria Basketball TOKYO (Japan) - Born in Nigeria, raised in the USA, Josh Okogie is working to build a proud and winning culture for D'Tigers basketball. Tokyo 2020 is the next step. 07/26/21 review Tokyo Day 2 all about champions: The habit of winning is impossible to kick TOKYO (Japan) - Whether you're at the start of your career, like Luka Doncic, or at the end of it, like Pau Gasol or Luis Scola, chasing the wins will always be priority #1 for champions. 07/26/21 news Tokyo Player of the Day | Simply sensational Olympic start for Slovenia's Luka Doncic TOKYO (Japan) - Luka Doncic pulled all the right strings for Slovenia during his Olympic debut against Argentina to put an authoritative stamp on today's Player of the Day | accolade. 07/26/21 fiba Tokyo How will rising Asia Cup contenders Japan fare at first Olympics appearance in 45 years? TOKYO (Japan) - One of the fastest rising basketball programs in Asia will be playing against the world’s best teams in Tokyo. Hopes are high for Japan and there’s a few good reasons why. 07/26/21 news Tokyo Guarantees in life: Death, taxes and Patty Mills going crazy in the green-and-gold TOKYO (Japan) - It's been 14 years since Patty Mills first played for the national team. And still, 5000 days later, here we are, amazed at what he's doing when it's AUSTRALIA emblazoned across his... 07/25/21 review Tokyo Day 1 proves the old premise: Big-time players win big-time games TOKYO (Japan) - Tomas Satoransky, the Italian forwards, Patty Mills, Evan Fournier. When the going gets tough, the tough get going and shine on the grandest of stages in all of sports ~ the Olympic... 07/25/21 news Tokyo Player of the Day | France's Evan Fournier TOKYO (Japan) - It took one day at the Olympics to remove any doubts about the competitiveness of the men's basketball tournament as Evan Fournier of France reminded everyone about his brilliance. 07/24/21 news Tokyo It all starts with defense for podium-chasing France TOKYO (Japan) - If France are going to have a chance of beating the USA at the Olympics and having a solid run that ends with a spot on the podium, they must be a team that plays great defense. 07/24/21 preview Tokyo Everything you need to know about the Men's Olympic Basketball Tournament in Tokyo TOKYO (Japan) - It's time for the FIBA Men's Olympic Basketball Tournament to finally tip-off! Here is everything you need to know about the event in Tokyo, including a group-by-group analysis. 07/24/21 press Tokyo Men's Olympic Basketball Tournament ready for tip-off tomorrow as final rosters confirmed TOKYO (Japan) - The Men's Olympic Basketball Tournament is ready for tip-off tomorrow at the Saitama Super Arena following the roster confirmation for the 12 participating teams at the Tokyo Games. 07/24/21 news Las Vegas Miye Oni's rising talent helping D'Tigers lift Nigeria's Olympic hoops hopes LAS VEGAS (USA) – Leading into the Tokyo 2020 Olympics, Miye Oni and the Nigerian men's basketball team have the look of a likely outsider looking to crash the historic USA and European medal party. 07/23/21 news Tokyo Can you name these Olympic medalists? TOKYO (Japan) - Basketball's legends have left indelible marks in Olympics history over the years. From the 'Mozart of Basketball' to 'La Bomba' how well can you do naming these iconic players? 07/23/21 news Miami Damian Lillard enters Olympic stage for the first time in Tokyo MIAMI (USA) - It’s not every day that a former two-star prospect and an ex-Weber State point guard reaches the NBA, let alone makes six All-Star Games, wins Rookie of the Year and becomes the face of a... 07/23/21 news Tokyo Can you name these Olympic medalists? TOKYO (Japan) - Basketball's legends have left indelible marks in Olympics history over the years. From the 'Mozart of Basketball' to 'La Bomba' how well can you do naming these iconic players? 07/23/21 news Tokyo Satoransky makes history as first Czech basketball player to serve as flag bearer TOKYO (Japan) - Tomas Satoransky will make history on Friday as the first basketball player to serve as flag bearer for the Czech Republic during the Opening Ceremony at the Olympics. 07/23/21 news Tokyo Patty Mills - You Can't Guard Him! TOKYO (Japan) - Patty Mills will be leading Australia as the flag bearer for the 2020 Tokyo Olympics Opening Ceremony. But Mills' real show comes on the court where he serves as the Boomers’ Superman. 07/23/21 fiba Tokyo Can Asia Cup 2017 champions claim a medal in Tokyo? TOKYO (Japan) - Australia are one of the top teams contending for the Olympic gold in men’s basketball this year. This should come as no surprise to those who watched the Boomers dominate Asia Cup 2017. 07/23/21 news Tokyo Men's Olympic Basketball Power Rankings - Volume 2 TOKYO (Japan) - The games in Saitama Super Arena tip off in two days. Sounds like a good time to check up on the form of the teams in our second edition of the pre-event Power Rankings. 07/22/21 news Riga Five female referees set for Olympic premiere in Tokyo RIGA (Lativa) - The opportunity to play at the Olympics is the stuff athlete dreams are made of. To referee at the Summer Games can also be a career-defining experience. 07/22/21 news Tokyo Six young guns with a chance to prove their worth in Tokyo TOKYO (Japan) - Playing at the Olympics is a dream come true for most of the world. It's not only that, but also a chance for these young talents to shine on the biggest of stages for the first time. 07/21/21 news Tokyo Expert musings, insights and picks for the Men's Olympic Basketball Tournament TOKYO (Japan) - With just days until the Men's Olympic Basketball Tournament gets underway, FIBA pulls two expert pundits into the hot seat as they make some bold and wildly entertaining predictions. 07/20/21 team Abuja Nigeria unveil Tokyo 2020 roster with eight NBA stars ABUJA (Nigeria) - Nigeria have unveiled their final 12-man roster for the upcoming Tokyo 2020 Olympic Games with four players expected to debut for the D'Tigers. 07/19/21 news Tokyo Rui Hachimura - You Can't Guard Him! TOKYO (Japan) - Rui Hachimura has become Japan's biggest hoops star and helped the country make history. How far can his impressive offensive game help guide Japan during their home Olympics? 07/19/21 news Las Vegas Spain load up for another run at Olympic gold LAS VEGAS (USA) - The Spain team that will compete at the Tokyo Olympics has a very familiar look to it with many of those included having won past major events or taken other steps of the podium. 07/18/21 news Tokyo Argentina include 10 World Cup finalists on Olympic roster LAS VEGAS (USA) - Sergio Hernandez endured "the worst day" of Argentina's preparations for the Olympics when naming the final 12 players that will compete at the Tokyo Games. 07/18/21 news Tokyo The one key question each Olympic men's team must answer TOKYO (Japan) - It is our job to ask the questions. This time around, we tried giving the answers, too. Only 12 teams get to play in Tokyo; the ones who figure out the answers themselves get to... 07/17/21 news Tokyo Upgrading from economy to business class: Six breakout players in Tokyo 2020 TOKYO (Japan) - If you make it to the Olympic Games, you know you did good in your career. But these guys aren't here just to participate, they are ready to use the biggest of stages, become global... 07/17/21 news Tokyo Facundo Campazzo - You Can't Guard Him! TOKYO (Japan) - For anybody watching Argentina play at the Tokyo 2020 Olympics, here is a tip: Don't take your eyes off Facundo Campazzo. You won't want to miss his out-of-this-world passing. 07/16/21 news Tokyo Luka Doncic - You Can't Guard Him! TOKYO (Japan) - There is no secret as to how Slovenia clinched a spot in the Olympics for the first time in history and did so in convincing, riveting, eye-opening fashion. Luka Doncic! 07/16/21 news Tokyo Men's Olympic Basketball Power Rankings - Volume 1 TOKYO (Japan) - The games in Tokyo 2020 tip-off in less than ten days. Sounds like a good timing to check up on the form of the teams in our first edition of the pre-event Power Rankings. 07/08/21 news Phoenix NBA Finals star Booker has one eye on Tokyo PHOENIX (United States) - Devin Booker is firmly focused on helping the Phoenix Suns capture the NBA title and the United States the gold medal at the Tokyo Olympics. 07/07/21 news Tokyo Mills, Samad and Hachimura chosen as flag-bearers for Opening Ceremony TOKYO (Japan) - Patty Mills has shone on the big stages of basketball with Australia and the San Antonio Spurs. He now has the ultimate honor, serving as Australia's flag-bearer at the Tokyo Olympics. 07/06/21 team Rome Italy strengthen Olympic roster with Gallinari ROME (Italy) - Coach Meo Sacchetti and Italy have bolstered their Olympic roster with the addition of Danilo Gallinari, the country's basketball federation announced on Tuesday. 07/06/21 news Mies Fan Vote! Who is on your FIBA Olympic Qualifying Tournament All-Star Five? MIES (Switzerland) - With all four tournaments in the books and the official awards handed out, it's time to give the floor to the fans as well. Who would be your ideal five from the Olympic qualifiers? 07/05/21 team Paris France load up with talent and experience for Tokyo PARIS (France) - Rudy Gobert and Evan Fournier will spearhead France's bid for Olympic glory after being named in the 12-man squad for the Tokyo Games. 07/05/21 press Belgrade Following FIBA OQTs, Tokyo 2020 Men's Olympics Basketball Tournament field set BELGRADE / KAUNAS / SPLIT / VICTORIA (Serbia / Lithuania / Croatia / Canada) - Czech Republic, Germany, Italy and Slovenia complete the Men's Olympic Basketball field for Tokyo 2020. 07/03/21 team Sydney Lockdown defender Matisse Thybulle joins veterans Mills, Ingles in star-studded Boomers squad SYDNEY (Australia) - Pat Mills, Joe Ingles, Aron Baynes and Matthew Dellavedova will play for Australia at the Tokyo Olympics and be joined by lockdown defender Matisse Thybulle. 07/01/21 review Belgrade Permutations: Which teams can still make the Semi-Finals at the OQTs? Following FIBA OQTs, Tokyo 2020 Men's Olympics Basketball Tournament field set 06/29/21 team Colorado Colangelo hails return of USA great Durant to squad for Tokyo Olympics COLORADO SPRINGS (United States) - USA Basketball's Jerry Colangelo paid a stirring tribute to Kevin Durant after the announcement that the superstar had committed to playing at the Tokyo Olympics. 06/25/21 news Mies Spectators anticipated at Olympic Qualifying Tournaments MIES (Switzerland) - Kept quiet by the pandemic until now, the sights and sounds of fans cheering from the stands during FIBA's upcoming Olympic Qualifying Tournaments looks to soon be a reality. 06/24/21 team California Nigeria open Tokyo 2020 camp in California with 49-man list CALIFORNIA (USA) - Former African champions Nigeria are hoping to make history at next months' Tokyo Olympics. 06/16/21 news Colorado USA receive Olympic commitments from Lillard, Green and Tatum COLORADO SPRINGS (United States) - The powerhouse trio of Damian Lillard, Draymond Green and Jayson Tatum are ready to suit up for the USA at this summer's Tokyo Olympics. 06/07/21 3x3 Debrecen The 16 teams who will compete in 3x3 at the Tokyo Olympics DEBRECEN (Hungary) - 16 teams, 8 men’s and 8 women’s are now qualified for the first-ever 3x3 event at the Olympic Games in Tokyo, Japan on July 24-28, 2021. 05/21/21 team Paris Gobert, Fournier to spearhead Tokyo Games campaign for experienced France PARIS (France) - France coach Vincent Collet named a star-studded Olympic team on Thursday night, one including eight players that finished third at the FIBA Basketball World Cup 2019 in China. 05/18/21 oqt Istanbul Osman, Korkmaz poised for Turkey return after being named among candidates for Victoria OQT ISTANBUL (Turkey) - Cedi Osman and Furkan Korkmaz are set to return for Turkey at the FIBA Olympic Qualifying Tournament (OQT) in Victoria, Canada, after being named among the 29 candidates for the... 05/17/21 oqt Slovenia Slovenia ready to take aim at Tokyo, include Doncic in Olympic Qualifying Tournament preliminary squad LJUBLJANA (Slovenia) - International hoops sensation Luka Doncic has been named in Slovenia's 24-man squad for next month's FIBA Olympic Qualifying Tournament (OQT) in Kaunas. 05/13/21 news Buenes Aires Sergio Hernandez confirmed as Argentina coach, upbeat about makeup of Olympic squad BUENOS AIRES (Argentina) - A very eager, enthusiastic and optimistic Sergio Hernandez has signed a new agreement that will see him coach Argentina at the Tokyo Olympics. 03/11/21 news Colorado USA beef up list of finalists for Tokyo Olympics COLORADO SPRINGS (United States) - The three-time defending champions USA announced 57 players as finalists for the team that will play at the Tokyo Olympics. 03/08/21 news Atlanta Kawhi Leonard looks forward to making his Olympic debut with USA ATLANTA (United States) - Kawhi Leonard declared over the weekend after playing at the NBA All-Star Game in Atlanta that he is planning on representing the United States at this summer's Tokyo Olympics. 03/01/21 news Mies Schedule and tip-off times confirmed for Olympic Basketball Tournaments MIES (Switzerland) - The game schedule and tip-off times have been confirmed for the Men's and Women's Olympic Basketball Tournaments in Tokyo, Japan. 02/05/21 news Tokyo Revenge games on the cards for Argentina and USA after Olympic draw TOKYO (Japan) - There was a strong feeling of unfinished business in Argentina's national team this week after the draw for Olympic Basketball Tournament at the House of Basketball in Mies. 02/03/21 news Dallas Two-time Olympian Ike Diogu excited about Nigeria's Tokyo 2020 draw DALLAS (USA) - Nigeria won't find out two of their Tokyo 2020 opponents until later on, but two-time Olympian Ike Diogu can't hide the D'Tigers' excitement to face the best teams in the world once... 02/03/21 news Melbourne Ingles, Mills and Simmons headline star-studded list of Australia players for Tokyo Olympics MELBOURNE (Australia) - Patty Mills, Joe Ingles and Ben Simmons are on Australia's star-studded 24-man list of players for the Boomers' forthcoming Olympic campaign. 02/02/21 news Tokyo Sergio Hernandez confirmed as Argentina coach, upbeat about makeup of Olympic squad BUENOS AIRES (Argentina) - A very eager, enthusiastic and optimistic Sergio Hernandez has signed a new agreement that will see him coach Argentina at the Tokyo Olympics. 01/29/21 news Mies Tokyo 2020 Olympic Basketball Tournaments Draw set for February 2nd MIES (Switzerland) - FIBA is pleased to announce that the Draw Ceremony of the Tokyo 2020 Olympic Basketball Tournaments, for both women and men, will take place on Tuesday, February 2nd. 01/18/21 news Sydney Mills says Boomers are fully committed, raring to go for Tokyo SYDNEY (Australia) - There are no ifs, ands or buts when it comes to the Australia and the Tokyo Olympics. The Boomers players, star Patty Mills says, are fully committed and raring to go. 01/13/21 africa Abidjan 2021 promises thrilling menu for African basketball ABIDJAN (Cote d'Ivoire) - The new year is finally here with us and with it comes an exciting new calendar that promises to wow African Basketball fans even if it means from the comfort of their couches... 01/06/21 news Mies Way-too-early Olympic predictions: Who will qualify and who will impress in Tokyo? MIES (Switzerland) - We have invited FIBA writers Julio Chitunda, Igor Curkovic, Sajjatam Kulsomboon and Jeff Taylor to share their thoughts and predictions for the busy summer ahead. 12/09/20 news Milwaukee Nigeria's Nwora: ''Playing for D'Tigers made me a better player'' MILWAUKEE (USA) - Years of wishful thinking and resilience finally paid off for Nigerian basketballer Jordan Nwora after he was drafted into the NBA as a second round pick by the Milwaukee Bucks. 11/13/20 news Sydney Goorjian returns to lead Australia at Tokyo Olympics SYDNEY (Australia) - Australia have turned back the clock and handed the national team reins to former Boomers coach Brian Goorjian. 10/01/20 europe Madrid Spain keep Scariolo, Mondelo in charge of national teams through Paris Olympics MADRID (Spain) - The FEB has announced that coaches Sergio Scariolo and Lucas Mondelo will remain at the helm of Spain's men's and women's national teams, respectively, through the Paris 2024 Olympics... 09/17/20 news Sydney Ingles, Australia aim to strike gold in Tokyo SYDNEY (Australia) - The mindset of the Australia players heading into the Tokyo Olympics is to capture a gold medal, according to veteran Boomer Joe Ingles. 07/29/20 news Buenes Aires Argentina lock in Sergio Hernandez as coach through Tokyo Olympics BUENOS AIRES (Argentina) - Of all the ingredients that gives a team its best chance of challenging for honors in international basketball, continuity at the helm is among the most important. 07/23/20 news Mies Cosic-led Yugoslavia had one of greatest runs in international basketball history MIES (Switzerland) - Yugoslavia heroes of 1980 should always be revered for bring the country its only Olympic gold medal. 07/17/20 news Mies IOC announces dates for basketball events at Tokyo Games MIES (Switzerland) - Countries competing in basketball events at next year's Tokyo Games now know when their respective tournaments will get underway following today's announcement by the IOC. 07/06/20 news Moscow The legend of Sergei Belov MOSCOW (Russia) - The name Sergei Belov figures prominently in discussions about the most influential figures of European basketball and for good reason. 06/26/20 news Buenes Aires Ginobili says Scola deserves to end Argentina career at Tokyo Olympics BUENOS AIRES (Argentina) - Manu Ginobili believes Luis Scola should compete for Argentina again next summer at the Tokyo Olympics before drawing the curtain on his legendary national team career. 06/15/20 news Mies France aim to use World Cup run as springboard for success at Tokyo Olympics MIES (Switzerland) - France evolved into a potent force last summer at the FIBA Basketball World Cup 2019 in China and reached the podium, providing hope of an Olympic medal run next year in Tokyo. 06/10/20 fiba New Dehli How did India play at the 1980 Summer Olympics? NEW DEHLI (India) - India basketball has not had the chance to be showcased at the world level - save for that one time where the India men’s basketball team played at the Summer Olympics in 1980. 05/27/20 news Mies The summer that Jerry West, Oscar Robertson and the USA conquered Rome MIES (Switzerland) - It happened more than half a century ago, yet for two of the biggest legends in the sport, Jerry West and Oscar Robertson, memories of their run to Olympic gold in Rome remain... 05/20/20 news Mies Russell's USA days among his most treasured as a basketball player
